Backgammon

Class BackgammonState

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backgammon.BackgammonState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BackgammonState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A state of the Backgammon game is characterized by a board containing a grid of spaces for disks, the next player to move, and a dice roll. The dice can be used or unused, and one of them will be selected. The utility is also stored as part of the state.
    Author:
    Andrew Socha

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackgammonState

        public BackgammonState(boolean first)
        BackgammonState constructor to create a board state
        Parameters:
        first - True if this is the initial state of the game, false otherwise. If true, we set up the game according to Backgammon's rules. Otherwise, this state is being used by the AI to clone another state, so we don't need to set up the board.

    • Method Detail

      • getUtility

        public double getUtility()
        Gets the utility of the state
        Returns:
        the utility (0-1)

      • getDieRoll

        public int getDieRoll(int die)
        Get the roll of one of the dice
        Parameters:
        die - the die to get the roll of (0 or 1)
        Returns:
        the die's roll (1-6)

      • getSelectedDie

        public int getSelectedDie()
        Gets the index of the selected die
        Returns:
        the index of the selected die (0 or 1)

      • changeSelectedDie

        public boolean changeSelectedDie()
        Changes which die is selected if the unselected die hasn't been used this turn.
        Returns:
        true if the selected die was changed, false otherwise

      • getPlayerNum

        public int getPlayerNum(int space)
        Gets the number of the player who owns the pieces on a space
        Parameters:
        space - a space on the board (0-25)
        Returns:
        the number or the player who owns the pieces (1 or 2) or 0 if no pieces are in that space

      • getCount

        public int getCount(int space)
        Gets the amount of pieces on a space of the board
        Parameters:
        space - a space on the board (0-25)
        Returns:
        the number of pieces on that space in the board (0-15)

      • getPlayerToMove

        public int getPlayerToMove()
        Gets the number of the player whose turn it is
        Returns:
        the current player's number (1 or 2)

      • shouldIgnoreDoubles

        public boolean shouldIgnoreDoubles()
        Used by the AI player to ignore the second die on a doubles roll. This eliminates some duplicate states in the AI's search tree.
        Returns:
        true if the AI should ignore the second die roll (doubles were rolled)

      • moveDisk

        public void moveDisk(int space,
                     boolean isComputer)
        Move the piece at the indicated space if it is a valid move
        Parameters:
        space - the space whose piece we are moving (0-25) 50-75 if the AI is playing with the unselected die -1 if the AI is playing and there are no valid moves
        isComputer - True if the AI is playing, false otherwise. This is solely used to speed up the move since the AI already knows its move is valid, but we have to check if a human player's move is valid.

      • rollDice

        public final void rollDice()
        Rolls the dice at the start of a new player's turn. Sets each die to a random value. Sets the each die to unused. Sets the selected die to die index 0. Inverts the utility of the state.

      • setDice

        public void setDice(int x,
                    int y)
        Sets the dice to specific rolls Used by the AI to consider specific future dice rolls
        Parameters:
        x - the first die's value (1-6)
        y - the second die's value (1-6)

      • canMoveOut

        private boolean canMoveOut(int space)
        Checks if a player can move his/her pieces off the board, which requires all of his/her pieces to be in the final 6 spaces.
        Parameters:
        space - the space the player is trying to move out from (1-6 or 19-24)
        Returns:
        true if the piece can be moved out, false otherwise

      • isValid

        public int isValid(int space)
        Checks if a given piece can be moved with the currently selected die
        Parameters:
        space - the space of the piece that we are checking (0-25)
        Returns:
        2 if the piece can move and either captures or moves out. 1 if the piece can simply move. 0 if the piece cannot move.

      • noValidMoves

        private boolean noValidMoves()
        Determines if any piece can be moved by the current player (with either die)
        Returns:
        true if no piece can be moved false if any piece can be moved

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal()
        Determines if the current player has won by checking if he has no pieces left. Assumes that all of the player's pieces are in his/her home board (final 6 spaces).
        Returns:
        true if the current player has won, false otherwise

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        Gets the index of the winning player. Assumes one player has no tiles remaining.
        Returns:
        the winning player's index

      • clone

        public BackgammonState clone()
        Clones the BackgammonState
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the cloned state
